## Graph info
::: {style="font-size: 1.25em; color: #38B44A;"}
**Should I use this graph?**
:::

<br>

```{r}
#| label: full_code_display
#| eval: true
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '30%'
#| out-width: '30%'
#| fig-align: right
#| layout-nrow: 3
library(fivethirtyeight)
library(ggplot2)
library(paletteer)
library(ggthemes)
# basic_line ----
usbirth_1994_2014 <- fivethirtyeight::US_births_2000_2014 |>
    dplyr::bind_rows(fivethirtyeight::US_births_1994_2003) |> 
    dplyr::mutate(
        day_category = case_when(
            day_of_week %in% c("Sun", "Sat") ~ "Weekend",
            day_of_week %nin% c("Sun", "Sat") ~ "Weekday",
            TRUE ~ NA_character_
        ),
        month = dplyr::if_else(
            condition = month < 10,
            true = paste0("0", month),
            false = as.character(month)
        ),
        yr_mnth = paste0(year, "-", month),
        yr_mnth = lubridate::ym(yr_mnth),
        yr_qtr = paste0(lubridate::year(date),
                              "/0", 
                              quarter(date)),
        yr_qtr = factor(yr_qtr, ordered = TRUE)
    )
## basic_line data ----
avg_birth_day_cat_yr <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::group_by(year, day_category) |>
    dplyr::summarise(avg_births = mean(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup() 
## basic_line graph ----
ggp2_line <- ggplot(data = avg_birth_day_cat_yr, 
       mapping = aes(x = year, 
                     y = avg_births, 
                     group = day_category)) + 
    geom_line(aes(color = day_category)) 
basic_line <- ggp2_line + 
    theme(axis.text = element_blank(), 
          legend.position = "none",
          legend.title = element_blank(),
          legend.text = element_blank())
# grp_line -----
## grp_line data ----
avg_births_dow_qtr <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::filter(year >= 2007 & year < 2009) |>
    dplyr::group_by(yr_qtr, day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::summarise(avg_births = mean(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup()
## grp_line graph ----
ggp2_line_grp <- ggplot2::ggplot(data = avg_births_dow_qtr,
       mapping = aes(x = yr_qtr,
                     y = avg_births,
                     group = day_of_week)) +
        geom_line(aes(color = day_of_week))
grp_line <- ggp2_line_grp +
    theme(axis.text = element_blank(),
          legend.text = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none",
          legend.title = element_blank())
# pal_line -----
avg_births_dow_mnth <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::filter(date > lubridate::as_date("2003-01-01") &
            date < lubridate::as_date("2003-06-01")) |>
    dplyr::group_by(yr_mnth, day_category, day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::summarise(avg_births = mean(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup()
# levels
ggp2_line_pal <- ggplot(data = dplyr::filter(avg_births_dow_mnth,
                        day_of_week %in% c("Tues", "Wed", "Thurs"))) +
                geom_line(aes(x = yr_mnth,
                            y = avg_births,
                            group = day_of_week,
                            color = day_of_week),
                            alpha = 1 / 5,
                            linewidth = 1.4) +
                geom_line(data = dplyr::filter(avg_births_dow_mnth,
                        day_of_week %in% c("Sat", "Sun")),
                       aes(x = yr_mnth,
                           y = avg_births,
                           group = day_of_week,
                           color = day_of_week),
                           alpha = 1 / 2,
                           linewidth = 1.0,
                           linetype = "longdash") +
                geom_line(data = dplyr::filter(avg_births_dow_mnth,
                        day_of_week %in% c("Mon", "Fri")),
                        aes(x = yr_mnth,
                           y = avg_births,
                           group = day_of_week,
                           color = day_of_week),
                           linewidth = 1.0)
# all four layers
pal_line <- ggp2_line_pal +
    theme(axis.text = element_blank(),
          legend.text = element_blank(),
          legend.background = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none",
          legend.key = element_blank(),
          legend.title = element_blank())
# facet_line -----
## facet_line data ----
avg_births_dcat_dow_mnth <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::filter(date > lubridate::as_date("2003-01-01") &
            date < lubridate::as_date("2003-06-01")) |>
    dplyr::group_by(yr_mnth, day_category, day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::summarise(avg_births = mean(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup()
## facet_line graph ----
ggp2_line_grp_facet <- ggplot(data = avg_births_dcat_dow_mnth,
    mapping = aes(x = yr_mnth,
                  y = avg_births,
              group = day_of_week)) +
    geom_line(aes(color = day_of_week),
        linewidth = 0.9) +
    scale_color_manual(values = c(
        "#30123B", "#4485F6", "#1AE4B6",
        "#A1FB3E", "#FABA39", "#E3460B",
        "#7A0403"
    )) +
    facet_wrap(. ~ day_of_week, nrow = 2)

facet_line <- ggp2_line_grp_facet +
    theme(axis.text = element_blank(),
          legend.text = element_blank(),
          legend.position = "none",
          strip.text = element_blank(),
          legend.title = element_blank())
# final graphs ----
basic_line + ggplot2::labs(y = "Y", x = "Time")
grp_line + ggplot2::labs(y = "Y", x = "Time")
pal_line + ggplot2::labs(y = "Y", x = "Time")
facet_line + ggplot2::labs(y = "Y", x = "Time")
```

Line graphs display changes of a numeric quantitative variable (on the `y` axis) over time (on the `x` axis). Color, line style, and faceting can be used to show group changes for categorical variables.

### Data

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**DATA:**
:::

::: {.column-margin}

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
We'll be using the `US_births_1994_2003` and `US_births_2000_2014` datasets from the `fivethirtyeight` package: 

  - Binding these together (they have identical columns)  

  - Create a `day_category` variable that distinguishes between weekdays (`Weekends`) and weekends (`Weekday`)  

  - Use `year` and `month`  to create `yr_mnth`  

  - Use `year` and `quarter` to create `yr_qtr` 

Save these changes to `usbirth_1994_2014`:

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: data_usbirth_1994_2014
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
usbirth_1994_2014 <- fivethirtyeight::US_births_2000_2014 |>
    dplyr::bind_rows(fivethirtyeight::US_births_1994_2003) |> 
    dplyr::mutate(
        day_category = case_when(
            day_of_week %in% c("Sun", "Sat") ~ "Weekend",
            day_of_week %nin% c("Sun", "Sat") ~ "Weekday",
            TRUE ~ NA_character_
        ),
        month = dplyr::if_else(
            condition = month < 10,
            true = paste0("0", month),
            false = as.character(month)
        ),
        yr_mnth = paste0(year, "-", month),
        yr_mnth = lubridate::ym(yr_mnth),
        yr_qtr = paste0(lubridate::year(date),
                              "/0", 
                              quarter(date)),
        yr_qtr = factor(yr_qtr, ordered = TRUE)
    )
dplyr::glimpse(usbirth_1994_2014)
```
:::

We'll use these data in the *More info* section for more line graphs, but for now:

- Group `usbirth_1994_2014` on `year` and `day_category`   

- Calculate the average `births` as `avg_births`  

Store the data in `avg_birth_day_cat_yr`:

:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: data_avg_birth_day_cat_yr
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
avg_birth_day_cat_yr <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::group_by(year, day_category) |>
    dplyr::summarise(avg_births = mean(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup() 
dplyr::glimpse(avg_birth_day_cat_yr)
```
:::
::::

:::: {.panel-tabset}

### Code

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**CODE:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}

- Create labels   

- Map `yr_mnth` to the `x`, `avg_births` to the `y`, and `day_category` to `group`

- Add the `geom_line()` layer and map `day_category` to color (*inside* `aes()`)

:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: code_graph_line
#| eval: false
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
labs_line_graph <- labs(title = "Average US births", 
                        subtitle = "1994-2014",
                        y = "Average number of US births",
                        x = "Year",  
                        color = "Day Category")

ggp2_line <- ggplot(data = avg_birth_day_cat_yr, 
       mapping = aes(x = year, 
                     y = avg_births, 
                     group = day_category)) + 
    geom_line(aes(color = day_category)) 
ggp2_line + 
    labs_line_graph
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}

#| label: create_graph_line

ggp2_line <- ggplot(data = avg_birth_day_cat_yr,

## More info

Line graphs are great for displaying relationships across variables with multiple groups (or levels). We can also use facets for multiple comparisons (i.e., small multiples).


:::: {.panel-tabset}

### Groups

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**DATA:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
In the previous graph, we can see the number of births begins to decline around `2007` or `2008`.  We'll create another summarized dataset from the `usbirth_2010_2014` data, but this time we restrict the observations to only births in between `2008` and `2009`, group on `yr_qtr` and `day_of_week`, and get the average number of `births` (as `avg_births`).

:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: avg_births_dow_qtr
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
avg_births_dow_qtr <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::filter(year >= 2008 & year <= 2009) |> 
    dplyr::group_by(yr_qtr, day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::summarise(avg_births = mean(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup() 
dplyr::glimpse(avg_births_dow_qtr)
```
:::


::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**GROUPS:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}

Now when we create our line graph, we will have a categorical variable with seven levels (`day_of_week`):

  + Create subtitle using `paste0()` to ensure it's accurate if/when the underlying data is updated.   
  +  move the legend to the top of the graph using  `theme(legend.position = "top")` (to improve readability).   

:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: labs_line_graph_grp
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
# here we create the labels (with the subtitle updating with the data)
labs_line_graph_grp <- labs(title = "Average US births", 
                        subtitle = paste0("Between ",
                                    min(avg_births_dow_qtr$yr_qtr), 
                                    " and ",
                                    max(avg_births_dow_qtr$yr_qtr)),
                        y = "Average births", 
                        x = "Year/Quarter",  
                        color = "Day of Week")
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: avg_births_dow_qtr_grp_line
#| code-fold: show
#| eval: true
#| echo: true 
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1

# Build layer with yr_qtr and day_of_week
ggp2_line_grp <- ggplot(data = avg_births_dow_qtr, 
                   mapping = aes(x = yr_qtr, 
                                 y = avg_births, 
                                 group = day_of_week)) + 
        geom_line(aes(color = day_of_week)) 
# move legend
ggp2_line_grp + 
    labs_line_graph_grp + 
    theme(legend.position = "top")
```
:::

### Palettes

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Palettes are a great way to highlight or emphasize some lines over others. 
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**DATA:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}

:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: avg_births_dow_mnth
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
avg_births_dow_mnth <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::filter(year >= 2008 & year < 2010) |>
    dplyr::group_by(yr_mnth, day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::summarise(avg_births = mean(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup()
dplyr::glimpse(avg_births_dow_mnth)
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**PALETTES:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: labs_line_graph_grp_pal
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
labs_line_graph_grp_pal <- labs(
    title = "Average US births",
    subtitle = paste0(
        "Between ",
        min(avg_births_dow_mnth$yr_mnth),
        " and ",
        max(avg_births_dow_mnth$yr_mnth)
    ),
    y = "Average births",
    x = "Year-Month",
    color = "Day of Week"
)
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Color palettes are a excellent too for highlighting or emphasizing certain lines over others.
 
We'll start by creating a line graph layer for Monday (`"Mon"`), Thursday (`"Thurs"`), and Friday (`"Fri"`) adjusting the opacity with `alpha`.
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: ggp2_line_pal_mon_thur_fri
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
ggp2_line_pal_mon_thur_fri <- ggplot(data = dplyr::filter(avg_births_dow_mnth,
                            day_of_week %in% c("Mon", "Thurs", "Fri"))) +
                    geom_line(aes(x = yr_mnth,
                                  y = avg_births,
                                group = day_of_week,
                                color = day_of_week),
                        alpha = 1 / 4,
                        linewidth = 0.85)
# layer 1 
ggp2_line_pal_mon_thur_fri + 
    labs_line_graph_grp_pal + 
    theme(legend.position = "top")
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Then we'll change the `linetype` of Saturday and Sunday to `"longdash'` (and make this *somewhat* transparent with a slightly higher `alpha`).
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: ggp2_line_pal_sat_sun
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
ggp2_line_pal_sat_sun <- ggp2_line_pal_mon_thur_fri + 
                            geom_line(data = dplyr::filter(avg_births_dow_mnth, 
                                     day_of_week %in% c("Sat", "Sun")), 
                               aes(x = yr_mnth,
                                   y = avg_births, 
                                   group = day_of_week,
                                   color = day_of_week), 
                                       alpha = 1 / 2, 
                                       linewidth = 0.75,
                                       linetype = "longdash") 
# layers 1 & 2
ggp2_line_pal_sat_sun + 
    labs_line_graph_grp_pal + 
    theme(legend.position = "top")
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Add `geom_line()` for Wednesday and Tuesday. 
:::


::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: ggp2_line_pal_wed_tues
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
# levels 
lev_order <- levels(avg_births_dow_mnth$day_of_week)
# layer 3
ggp2_line_pal_wed_tues <- ggp2_line_pal_sat_sun + 
                            geom_line(data = dplyr::filter(avg_births_dow_mnth, 
                                     day_of_week %in% c("Wed", "Tues")), 
                               aes(x = yr_mnth,
                                   y = avg_births, 
                                   group = day_of_week,
                                   color = day_of_week),
                                   linewidth = 1.25)
# three layers 
ggp2_line_pal_wed_tues + 
    labs_line_graph_grp_pal + 
    theme(legend.position = "top")
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: ggp2_line_pal_d
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
library(paletteer)
library(ggthemes)
library(rcartocolor)
library(RColorBrewer)
ggp2_line_pal_d <- ggp2_line_pal_wed_tues +
    # add palette 
    ggplot2::scale_color_manual(
        breaks = lev_order,
        values = paletteer::paletteer_d(
            palette = "ggthemes::Color_Blind", 
            n = 7))

ggp2_line_pal_d +
    labs_line_graph_grp_pal + 
    theme(legend.position = "top")
```
:::

### Labels

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**LABELS:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
In the previous graph, we can see the number of average births reaches it's peak in quarter three of `2008`. 

We're going to create a small table of labels, `label_dow`, that we'll use to label the maximum and minimum values. `label_dow` will have 7 rows (one for each day of the week) and a label variable (`lbl`) which we can use with `geom_label()`
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: label_dow
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
label_dow <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::group_by(day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::summarise(
        max_births = max(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup() |>
    dplyr::arrange(desc(max_births)) |>
    dplyr::rename(day = day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::mutate(lbl = paste0(day, 
                               ", max births = ", 
                               max_births)) |>
    dplyr::inner_join(y = usbirth_1994_2014, 
                      by = c("max_births" = "births")) |>
    dplyr::select(day, max_births, lbl, 
        date, day_category, yr_mnth, yr_qtr)
label_dow
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Use `filter()` to get maximum and minimum values for `"Wed"` and `"Tues"` (in `label_max_wed_dow` and `label_min_tues_dow`):
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: label_wed_tues_dow
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-ncol: 2
# get max day of the week
label_max_wed_dow <- label_dow |> 
    filter(day == "Wed")
label_max_wed_dow
# get min day of the week
label_min_tues_dow <- label_dow |> 
    filter(day == "Tues")
label_min_tues_dow
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Add `geom_point()`
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: ggp2_line_wed_births_lbl
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
# point for max births/day
ggp2_line_wed_births_pnts <- geom_point(data = label_max_wed_dow,
    aes(x = yr_mnth,
        y = max_births,
        color = day),
    show.legend = FALSE) 

ggp2_line_wed_births_lbls <- geom_label(data = label_max_wed_dow,
        aes(x = yr_mnth,
            y = max_births,
            label = lbl,
            color = day),
        fill = "#ffffff",
        nudge_y = -650,
        size = 3,
        show.legend = FALSE)

ggp2_line_pal_d + 
    ggp2_line_wed_births_pnts + 
    ggp2_line_wed_births_lbls + 
    # add labels
    labs_line_graph_grp_pal +
    # move legend to top
    theme(legend.position = "top")
```
:::


::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Add `geom_label()`
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: ggp2_line_min_births_lbl
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
# point for max births/day
ggp2_line_tues_births_pnts <- geom_point(data = label_min_tues_dow,
    aes(x = yr_mnth,
        y = max_births,
        color = day),
    show.legend = FALSE) 

ggp2_line_tues_births_lbls <- geom_label(data = label_min_tues_dow,
        aes(x = yr_mnth,
            y = max_births,
            label = lbl,
            color = day),
        fill = "#ffffff",
        nudge_y = -650,
        size = 3,
        show.legend = FALSE)

ggp2_line_pal_d + 
    # wednesday layers 
    ggp2_line_wed_births_pnts + 
    ggp2_line_wed_births_lbls +  
    # tuesday layers 
    ggp2_line_tues_births_pnts + 
    ggp2_line_tues_births_lbls +
    # add labels
    labs_line_graph_grp_pal +
    # move legend to top
    theme(legend.position = "top")
```
:::

### Facets

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**DATA:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Facets....
:::


::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: max_births_dcat_dow_mnth
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
med_births_dcat_dow_mnth <- usbirth_1994_2014 |>
    dplyr::filter(date >= lubridate::as_date("2008-07-01") &
            date < lubridate::as_date("2010-01-01")) |>
    dplyr::group_by(date, day_category, day_of_week) |>
    dplyr::summarise(med_births = median(births, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
    dplyr::ungroup()
dplyr::glimpse(med_births_dcat_dow_mnth)
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.90em; color: #1e83c8;"}
**FACETS:**
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}
Facets....
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: labs_line_graph_facet
#| code-fold: true
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
labs_line_graph_facet <- labs(
    title = "Median US births",
    subtitle = paste0("Between ",
        min(med_births_dcat_dow_mnth$date),
        " and ",
        max(med_births_dcat_dow_mnth$date)),
    y = "Median births",
    x = "Date",
    color = "Day of Week")
```
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.75em;"}
```{r}
#| label: create_graph_line_grp_facet
#| code-fold: show
#| eval: true
#| echo: true
#| warning: false
#| message: false
#| out-height: '100%'
#| out-width: '100%'
#| column: page-inset-right
#| layout-nrow: 1
ggp2_line_grp_facet <- ggplot(data = med_births_dcat_dow_mnth,
    mapping = aes(x = date,
                  y = med_births,
              group = day_of_week)) +
    geom_line(aes(color = day_of_week)) +
    scale_color_manual(values = c("#30123B", "#4485F6", 
        "#1AE4B6", "#A1FB3E", "#FABA39", "#E3460B", "#7A0403")) +
    scale_y_continuous(breaks = c(4000, 8000, 12000, 16000), 
                       labels = c('4000', '8000', '12000', '16000')) +
    facet_wrap(day_of_week ~ ., shrink = TRUE)

ggp2_line_grp_facet + 
    labs_line_graph_facet
```
